review: The real deal!. I loved this place. It is gritty, no frill, Chicago style hot dog. Walk in, order and go. The fries are wrapped up in the same package as the hot dog and the price is excellent. This may be one of the best kept secrets to the out of town visitor. This was Chicago!

A Part of My History!. Over 62 years ago, my father wanted to purchase a small strip of land located on the northwest corner of Grand and Pulaski. He said that it would be the perfect place for a hotdog stand~and! he was right. Unfortunately, being a newly returned vet from WWII, he did not have the financial backing.  Jimmy's would have been called Paddy's. Either way, Jimmy's is a part of my past. I remember walking there fir hotdogs send fries after shopping on North Ave. It was also my oasis to warm-up after walking home through the blizzard of 1967! (I bought a vague of fries to get warm!)  Fond memories and happy times! (Genuine Chicago-style dog!)

Great Chitown red hot.. Where the locals go for hot dogs.  No ketchup, no pretentious people, not for those afraid of the city.   Fresh fries, great dogs & fast service.   One of my first stops when I come back home. The best hot dog & fries for the money in the City.  Order one all the way, grab a pop and enjoy.
